reviewComments: Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
details:
Russian water pollutants data collected by two Russian federal agencies. 

Primary agency is "Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Welfare" (Rospotrebnadzor). 

This agency collects data about water and air pollutants but it's network is "shadowed". No data available at agency website http://rospotrebnadzor.ru/ (Rus) and it's official open data repository - http://opendata.rospotrebnadzor.ru/

I've visited every website of every facility owned by Rospotrebnadzor but no one provides water quality data as open data or report.

Second agency is Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring of Russia  (Roshydromet).  

Yearly water surface quality report prepared and published by Institute of Global Climate and Ecology of Roshydromet and Russian Academy of Sciences. It's subsidiary research facility of Roshydromet. Organization website - http://www.igce.ru/ (Rus) 

Last report was published for 2015 year http://downloads.igce.ru/publications/obz_gidrobiol_2/og_2015.pdf (Rus)
first report was public and online since 2007 year http://downloads.igce.ru/publications/obz_gidrobiol/og_2007.pdf (Rus)

This report is highly incomplete in terms of open data. 
It's dedicated to water surface quality only and has no detailed data by each chemical.

So requirement "In order to satisfy the minimum requirements for this category, data should be available on level of the following chemicals by water source."  is not matched for this data in Russia.

Disclaimer:  I am founder of NGO "Informational Culture" and OKI Ambassador in Russia (member of OKI Russia core team). I have no any affilation with Roshydromet or Rospotrebnadzor.

The original submission had to be rejected because not all four characteristics could be found online. More specifically, datasets included Company Names and Unique Identifiers, but not Company Addresses. According to submitter, the annualized data available both in the data portal and in the information system of companies in Colombia correspond to the latest available. This is because companies have a deadline to report until March of the following year. The data for 2016 comes after March 2017 and the available data are updated. The Superintendency of Companies makes available to the public the database with the financial statements of the 26,611 companies in the real sector that reported their balance sheets, income statements and cash flow for 2015 (thousands of pesos). Balance sheets and statements of income are available for free online on the Open data Portal under the creative commons public license. Accessing cash flows requires a user name and password but balance sheets and statements of income do not. The geographic coverage is national and the update frequency is weekly, although data appear to be from 2015. Each dataset is available separately and downloadable at once in .XLS format. However, information includes NIT (Número de Identificación Tributaria - Colombian business tax number), Business Name, City, Department, CIIU (Unified Industrial Information Code), and Sector, but not full Company Address. https://www.datos.gov.co/Econom-a-y-Finanzas/Balance-general-2015/axpt-nxv2 https://www.datos.gov.co/Econom-a-y-Finanzas/Estados-de-Resultados-2015/4nua-mduk https://www.datos.gov.co/Econom-a-y-Finanzas/Flujo-de-Efectivo-2015/qap6-cmfd Also, the Business Reporting and Reporting System - SIREM - presents the financial statements with a cut at December 31 of each year that are supplied by the companies that are subject to supervision, control and inspection by this Superintendency and that belong to the real sector of the economy. Data are downloadable at once for free in a .ZIP file that contains .XLS formats. Again, information includes NIT (Número de Identificación Tributaria - Colombian business tax number), Business Name, City, Department, CIIU (Unified Industrial Information Code), and Sector, but not full Company Address. http://www.supersociedades.gov.co/asuntos-economicos-y-contables/estudios-y-supervision-por-riesgos/SIREM/Paginas/default.aspx
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
While reviewing this submission, I have taken into consideration remarks made by Augusto Herrmann on the Open Knowledge forum. Indeed, while the submitter seems to have been very thoughtful in their response, and has actually found all major official sources of company data in Brazil, each of the different official sources have quite different characteristics. More specifically:

Receita Federal do Brasil
Access to company data in Brazil - on a federal level - is very limited. In order to access data, one needs to know the identification number (CNPJ) of the company. There is no service where people can search for the identification number if they only know the name. 
This is the official registry for taxation purposes, and the most reliable national registry of companies in Brazil. As the submitter mentioned, the query on their website only allows you to fetch information in one company at a time and you have to fill a Captcha to get it. Results are given in .HTML format and include Registration Number, Opening date, Business name, Title of establishment, Code and Description of the main economic activity, Code and Description of the secondary economic activities, Code and Description of the legal status, Public place, number, zip code, district, county, e-mail, phone, and registration status. Data cannot be downloaded in bulk and website's data update frequency is not known. One might argue that all company data is in the public domain in Brazil since according to Article 7, III of Law 9.610/1998 (Brazilian copyright law), databases are only copyrightable if their creation has involved a creative step ("criação intelectual"). A registry of companies is just a collection of factual information, so it is in fact not copyrightable. 

Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística - IBGE
http://brasilemsintese.ibge.gov.br/servicos/numero-de-empresas-por-segmento-de-servico.html
http://www.sidra.ibge.gov.br/bda/pesquisas/cempre/
Brasil em síntese and the SIDRA system have aggregate data. While this may be useful for some purposes, aggregate data probably don't qualify for the company registry of the GODI, as it should have data on each individual company.
Also, the data is offered as tables in a webpage, and there appears to be no download option.

Ministério do Planejamento, Desenvolvimento e Gestão
http://compras.dados.gov.br/fornecedores/v1/fornecedores.html
http://dados.gov.br/dataset/compras-publicas-do-governo-federal
There is an API call (and corresponding entry on the open data portal), on government suppliers, within the open data API for government procurement, acquisition and contracts.
However, this is incomplete, as it only contains data on companies that have ever supplied goods or services to government, or those who have ever registered as a requirement for any businesses to be allowed to apply for a bid in public tenders.
As an incomplete register of companies, this has not been considered to qualify for this dataset in previous editions of the Index.

Ministério da Transparência, Fiscalização e Controladoria-Geral da União
http://transparencia.gov.br/
Portal da Transparência also offers downloads for the same data of the registry of supplier companies.
This is also incomplete and hasn't been considered to qualify in past editions of the Index.

Juntas comerciais
There is one of these in each of the 26 Brazilian states and federal district. They are the official registry of companies de jure, i.e. when you want to register a new company you go there. Some of them have a query form online that allows for some kind of search in company names, e.g. the one in the State of São Paulo.
In the São Paulo example, the information available on each company is quite detailed, but you can only get one at a time and there is no kind of bulk download available.
Some states require a login in order to search, e.g. states of Minas Gerais and Paraná.
Others require you to fill an inquiry form and wait for a response from some public official, e.g. the state of Mato Grosso.
Still others (e.g. Paraíba) offers to send you a listing of all companies registered in the state for a fee.
Finally, some (e.g. Amapá) do not appear to even offer some basic kind of name discovery service, at least not that can be used by internet.

In conclusion, it seems that the only way of accessing company data is via the Receita Federal do Brasil website but again, these are behind a search mask so one needs to know an entity's unique identifier in order to find it.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Company data are available online and free of charge on both the Register of Commerce and the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies websites. However, in both cases data are available through a search mask, in .HTML format, and cannot be downloaded in bulk. On the Register of Commerce (Infogreffe) website, search results include Company name, Address,  SIREN/SIRET numbers (unique French business identification numbers), Number of establishments, and Activity. One then has the option of purchasing information such as official documents. 
On the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE) - Company search (Sirene) feature, one can look for company information by searching an entity's SIREN/SIRET number. Company name, SIRET number, Main activity held, Workforce, and Shelf Validity Year are included in the results.
However, like the submitter has mentioned, as of January 2017, one can download the Sirene database for free on the Open platform of French public data as data are opened under the law for a digital Republic. One can download the complete Sirene dissemination base of active institutions on the last day of the previous month, the daily update files for the current month, and monthly updates file for the previous month (Source: http://www.sirene.fr/sirene/public/static/acces-donnees). Each compressed file (ZIP format) contains a data file in .CSV format. Files contain variables of identification, address, geographical location and economic data on companies and establishments. They do not contain certain information (telephone numbers, e-mail and website addresses, names of executives, legal elements, balance sheets, geolocalized data). The dataset can be downloaded in bulk, is updated monthly, applies for the whole of France, and is openly licensed (under the law for a digital Republic).
details:
INSEE manages a company register (SIRENE) which also includes non-for-profit entities. Access and reuse of the database is possible against charging fees. Infogreffe also manages company data collected through commercial courts. Some data can be viewed online, but reuse of the whole database is also subject to fees. It is however expected that this dataset will be made available as open data in 2017 as announced by the Minister in charge of Digital Economy.

Lastly, according to a 2015 law on Economy and Growth, company data collected by commercial courts shall now be transferred to INPI and managed through a Central Company Register (RNCS) and released as open data. However, the release of RNCS data has still to be done and there is evidence that the database is still sold to third party. In the meantime, Infogreffe has launched its own open data catalog but does not provide the full register of companies, only secondary data on the activity of Infogreffe.

value.descValue: Federal Financial Supervisory Authority - database of companies
Common register portal of the German federal states

reviewComments:
Company data are available online and free of charge on the Federal Financial Supervisory Authority website under "database of companies". Although there is a Search feature, if you leave the "Company / Institute" search field blank, you will get a complete list of all companies / institutes listed in the database, or all companies / institutes in a particular category. You can also use the letter fields to filter companies with their respective initial letters. "Other" filters companies that start with numbers, umlauts or special characters. Data are given in .HTML format once company name is selected, and include Name, Address, and ID number.  The contents and documents accessible via the website of BaFin may in principle be stored, passed on and reproduced. If the contents or documents are different, the content is different. The transmission or duplication is only permitted with a clear indication of the source. Update frequency of data is not provided.

Data are also found on the Common register portal of the German federal states. These are available through a search mask and one needs to know the name of an entity in order to find it. Selecting "UT – Entity" from the results, Company name, HRB number and address are given in .HTML format. One then has the option of buying further company information and documents in .PDF. It is stated that the relevance to the current situation of the data you can view in the register is guaranteed. You will receive authentic data from the official register, because a search is always performed among the real-time data of the register of companies. However, the data viewed and retrieved by the subscriber may be used only for informational purposes. Use of the data to create one's own register as a counterpart to the Trade Register is not permitted. The subscriber is bound to refrain from creating or maintaining his own register as a counterpart to the Trade Register and from providing the data retrieved to anyone for such purposes. The subscriber is also bound to limit the frequency of his recalls to 60 in the hour. He may otherwise expect a temporary block of his user ID. If the user is able to prove that he has a justified reason for accessing the data more frequently it is also possible upon prior consultation with the Register Portal service department to obtain permission for additional access time for a limited period. For data retrievals from federal states in which he is not charged the subscriber is additionally bound to use the retrieved data only for those purposes for which fees are not levied and not to pass on the data to third parties.

Another source is the Land of North Rhine-Westphalia represented by the Ministry of Justice - Register notices website, under the "Find Announcement" feature. Again, data are available through a search mask where Company names, HRB numbers ("HR" means "Handelsregister" - the Commercial Register. Section B is the part of the register where records of limited companies are maintained) and address are given in .HTML in the Announcements. Update frequency and type of license is unknown.

Lastly, it may be worth noting that the Company Register - The central platform for the storage of company data website provides only Name, District Court, HRB, Status, but no address:
https://www.unternehmensregister.de/ureg/index.html?dest=ureg&language=en

answers.commentValue: Contracts Finder is the first Google result return based on a search for "uk government contracts", so should be relatively easy for most people to find.
The Open Government Licence applies to the available data.

It is important to note that many Government departments and agencies do not (yet) participate in Contracts Finder to a meaningful extent, so it is not a cross-government body of procurement data. CCS publishes statistics on Contracts Finder use by publishers: https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/Summary

Contracts Finder is an open public procurement platform administered by CCS. A daily file of notices is published as open data on Data.gov.uk. Data.gov.uk also holds a static open data archive of notices from an earlier version of Contracts Finder that was live from Feb 2011 through Feb 2015.

reviewComments:
The submitter provided a link for the Companies Registration Office (Bolagsverket) website which offers a search feature to find company information by company name or registration number. However, the results provide only the company name and identification number, and no address. One needs to pay a fee in order to download filings which may contain further information. Needless to say, the data are not openly licensed:
http://www.bolagsverket.se/en/us/about/e-services/foretagsfakta
I have been able to find company data free of charge on the Financial Supervisory Authority website through their Company register search feature. Again, one needs to know the name or number of an entity in order to find it. Results include Name, Corporate identification number and once selected the company name, Address, Telephone, Category, and FI identification number are also given in .HTML format. While data cannot be downloaded in bulk, according to the website they are regularly updated, and may be used free of charge (though you are asked to state the source, Financial Supervisory Authority and date). Financial Supervisory Authority's data is available at no charge and may be freely processed and re-used without special permission or agreements.
http://www.fi.se/en/our-registers/company-register/

answers.commentValue: Bills are listed based on the day they were proposed. Votes on bills per member are made available but only those bills that were approved and only for the votes that took place in the Camera de Diputados (not available for Senate votes). Transcripts of debates could not be found for any bill. The journey of the bill through the legislative process is available under the title of the bill.

The original submission also includedhttps://www.gob.mx/cofemer/articulos/simir?idiom=es as a source. As a reviewer I disregarded this source because it seems to be geared more toward bureaucratic transparency (it lists resolutions, regulations of various departments/agencies) and it is not necessarily directed at proposed legislation.

reviewComments: This is an updated version on the original review. The original submission had been accepted because all the required characteristics are present in the data set.
details:
I chose to mark "votes on bills" as present. Information on votes is very consistently made available for bills approved by the House of Deputies. Because the information is made available for at least some bills, I have chosen to mark it as present. I was a bit more lax on this point because it is an optional characteristic. I made a change from the original submission to indicate that transcripts were not available, as I could not find them. There needs to be an important caveat to my decision to mark "status of bills" as present. I noticed that a lot of older bills (eg. from 2005) did not have any status updates on them other than "referred to so-and-so committee). Some other bills from the same year did have updates (eg. approved by Deputies on a certain date). I am not sure of the reason why so many bills did not have updates. It could be because the bills just died in committee or it just takes very long for certain bills to move through the legislative process (eg. some bills introduced in 2005 were only voted on by the deputies in 2010). It is also a possibility that the government was not consistent on updating the status of all bills online. If this is the case than "status of bills" would have to be changed accordingly and the "information up to date" would probably also have to change. I was not able to prove the possibility of the government inconsistently providing status updates, so I am marking "status of bills" as present and B6 as a YES.
I updated the review after Enrique_Zapata's feedback. The only change that has been made is to change B5 to No.

reviewComments:
The submitter has provided a link to the Union of Chambers and Commodity Exchanges of Turkey - Turkish Trade Registry Gazette website. However, data are available only on request and behind a paywall: "Because the Turkish Trade Registry Gazette is not published with index information of companies, they are presented to users via the internet in exchange of a fee on a request to get information about a company. The information which exists in the Turkish Trade Registry Gazette Data-Base are shown below here: Name of Company, Trade Registry Number, Type of Announcement/ Explanation, Number of the Gazette, Page Numbers of the Announcements, City Code of the Company, Municipality Code of the Company. Index-information which have existed since 01.01.1992 till now in our web site, are given in exchange of 3.000 TL and the fee of a yearly subscription is 1.200 TL. Users wanting to get Turkish Trade Registry Gazette Index-information via the internet, have to make a remittance to the Turkish Trade Registry Gazette Bank Account, Türkiye İş Bankası Akay Branch. Branch number is 4201, Account number is 676466, then they have to post the extract of account with an application letter to BHDB."
http://www.ticaretsicil.gov.tr/english/genel/veritabani.php
I was able to find that the Turkish Standards Institution, a related institution of the Ministry of Science, Industry and Technology, offers a "Certified Company Search" feature on their webpage. Company Name, Company Address, Company Phone, Fax, E-Mail, Certification Number, Last Validity Date, Province where document is given, Province of Company, Document Status, and Product Group are available online, free of charge, in .HTML format. However, one needs to know the name or certification number of an entity in order to find it, as well as enter a captcha code. Data cannot be downloaded in bulk, while update frequency and type of license are unknown.
https://belge.tse.org.tr/Genel/FirmaArama.aspx

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Company data including name, number, and address are available online free of charge, updated no later than 5 days after making changes, and downloadable at once in Zipped .XML format on three different web sources: the State Enterprise "National Information Systems" - Unified State Register of Legal Entities and Individuals - Entrepreneurs and Community Groups, the Ministry of Justice, and the Open Data portal. As the submitter has commented, State Enterprise "National Information Systems" administers registry on behalf of the Ministry of Justice of Ukraine. Description pages, direct and metadata links are provided. Data can be found on Ukraine's open data portal, and on government agency's official sites. Originally, the data were found on Facebook news feed, in the first hours of announcement. In addition, economical activity NACE code, director and registration status are provided. More fields are available through online form. XML contains non-UTF-8 charset. Previously it was in .CSV but has now changed to .XML format. Payment is required only for additional fields and API. Direct links to full zip-archives are provided. No formal license is mentioned, but the terms of use are on every page of the open data portal. reviewComments: No other comments to add
details:
Historical data for precipitation amount, temperature extremes and wind speed can be found at: http://estaciones.inameh.gob.ve/descargaDatos/vistas/bajarArchivo.php

This interface allows to retrieve weather observations for each single measurement station (need to be requested individually). The data is available as XLS, and it seems that the original submission wrongly referred to this data.

Forecasts for current day and following two days are available at: http://www.inameh.gob.ve/web/tiempo/tiempo.php as well as under http://www.inameh.gob.ve/web/modelo_matematico.php

The forecasts are all presented as javascript features embedded on the website, or are published as PDF. They are not machine-readable. 

Also it could not be verified wether the data is in public domain or not. An open license is missing, and a copyright notice states that all rights reserved to INAMEH. Therefore the reviewer changed the submission to "No open license/no public domain".

answers.value: Servicio Nacional de Contrataciones adscrito a la Comisión Central de Planificación

reviewComments: The National Contracting Service - Central Planning Commission appears to be responsible for collecting company data. In fact, there is a "Public Consultation of Registered Companies" Search feature available on their website where one should be able to search entity information by using a company's name or RIF (Tax Information Registry) number. According to the submitter's comments, "data including company name, address, and unique identifier are available online in .HTML and .TXT format, but can not be downloaded. In some cases the registration of the companies is updated (what must be done annually or when there are changes in the articles of incorporation), but in other cases the information is outdated, incomplete. The information is in the public domain because there are no access barriers to obtain it, but the platform does not expose any declarations of public domain to inform the user. You have to scrape the information in order to get the data and use it." The submitter notes that the public consultation is one of the national government platforms that research journalists use the most to find information on state contracting companies. While the information is not available to download at once, the data are structured in a user-friendly way. However, I have been unable to verify this submission, as the website is not responding to any search queries. I have tried using different Venezuelan Company Names and RIF numbers (obtained through online searching) but every time, the search returns no results (note that it is not stated that no results were found, it simply does not produce any results). Perhaps it is a case of a glitch that will be resolved in the (near) future, but at the time being, I cannot obtain access to any data and therefore have no option but to mark the dataset as non-existent. http://rncenlinea.snc.gob.ve/reportes/consulta_publica?p=1 I have also tried accessing Venezuela's revenue service, SENIAT (Servicio Nacional Integrado de Administración Aduanera y Tributaria - National Integrated Service for the Administration of Customs Duties and Taxes), looking for a company tax identification code (RIF) search option, but the website seems to be down. http://www.seniat.gob.ve/

answers.value: Latvijas Vēstnesis - the official publication of the Republic of Latvia
answers.commentValue:
http://likumi.lv/about.php

Latvijas Vēstnesis and likumi.lv is regulated by the Law on Official Publications and Legal Information: http://www.likumi.lv/doc.php?id=249322

value.descValue: The official website providing free access to systematized (consolidated) legislation of the Republic of Latvia
the official publication of the Republic of Latvia

answers.commentValue:
People are usually interested in the consolidated versions of laws available at likumi.lv while https://www.vestnesis.lv/ publishes official decisions which are incremental (you may have separate publications for the initial law and tens of amendments).

If there are any inconsistencies between these two sources, what was published in Latvijas Vēstnesis is the official version. That's why the law states that Latvijas Vēstnesis is the official publication and likumi.lv is for "informative purposes".

reviewComments: The submission fulfills all criteria. Per the submitter, "people are usually interested in the consolidated versions of laws available at likumi.lv while https://www.vestnesis.lv/ publishes official decisions which are incremental (you may have separate publications for the initial law and tens of amendments). If there are any inconsistencies between these two sources, what was published in Latvijas Vēstnesis is the official version. That's why the law states that Latvijas Vēstnesis is the official publication and likumi.lv is for "informative purposes"." The reviewer was aware of the sources, although web searches with basic keywords only produce the Likumi link, and not Vestnesis. Vēstnesis translates most accurately to journal and searches including this keyword produces the link. The information is not available in a public domain, but is hosted and run by https://www.lv.lv/. The submitter provides more information in this regard, explaining that  "Likumi.lv points to the legislation that determines how this information can be reused and sets the fee for reuse (however, it is not clear what is meant by reuse and if, e.g., publishing law excerpts on a website requires paying the fee or not): see http://likumi.lv/doc.php?id=254491 or, http://likumi.lv/doc.php?id=249322#p18. The official publisher Latvijas Vestnesis does not receive budget funding for the maintenance of Likumi.lv. It is maintained from the earnings of Latvijas Vestnesis (including official publication and information reuse fees). The submitter originally indicated that the information was available in HTML, while the laws are available for download and are embedded as PDF. The submitter states that the information requires some effort as the information is contained in plain HTML. This was not my experience, however the rating remains the same to reflect the necessary effort to download the information available in PDF.

value.descValue: The Tunisian Register of Commerce (Registre de Commerece de Tunisie) website

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
The Tunisian Register of Commerce (Registre de Commerece de Tunisie) website offers a company search feature. Interestingly, any searches I conducted by company name, Register of Commerce number, and tax identification number did not return any results and only after conducting a search with the Register State parameter set for "active" did I get a list of results. Once selected an entity's "View More" option, Registry Number, Legal Form, State of the Register, Company name, Trade name, and Address of Headquarters are provided. One has the option to buy available documents, including Company ID for 5,900 DT. Data are given in .HTML format and cannot be downloaded at once. The update frequency is also not known.
The Ministry of Industry and Trade - Institut National de la Normalisation et de la Propriete Industrielle website offers lists of certified companies in .PDF which include company name, scope of certification, address, and certificate number:
http://www.innorpi.tn/Fra/entreprises-certifiees_21_45
It might be worth noting that the Tunisian Industry Portal website by the Agency for the Promotion of Industry and Innovation offers the following features:
Directory of industrial enterprises search:
http://www.tunisieindustrie.nat.tn/en/dbi.asp
Directory of Service enterprises:
http://www.tunisieindustrie.nat.tn/en/dbs.asp
List of Tunisian Certified Enterprises:
http://www.tunisieindustrie.nat.tn/en/certifdbi.asp
However, while all three options provide company names and addresses, they do not include unique identifiers.

reviewComments: The submitter was under the impression that data were not available online free of charge and without providing a type of identification. Indeed, the cost of downloading a copy of a file is $20.00 TTD (files are in PDF format). However, data are available via the Companies Registry Online Search Facility where one needs to know the name of an entity in order to find it. Results include company name, number, address, date of incorporation, name suffix, and status in .HTML format. Results cannot be downloaded in bulk, and update frequency of the data is unknown.
details:

Search fee: $20.00 per company file/document."
This suggest that the data carries a fee for access and requires in person application

answers.value: Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring of Russia (Roshydromet)

reviewComments: Accepted without corrections. Confirmed with other sources the description given by reviewer.
details:
Russian air pollutants data collected by two Russian federal agencies. Primary agency is Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring of Russia  (Roshydromet).  

Yearly air pollution quality report prepared and published by The Voeikov Main Geophysical Observatory. It's subsidiary research facility of Roshydromet. Organization website - http://www.voeikovmgo.ru/ (Rus) 

Last report was published for 2015 year http://www.voeikovmgo.ru/images/stories/publications/2016/ejegodnik_zagr_atm_2015.pdf (Rus)
first report was public and online since 2006 year http://www.voeikovmgo.ru/download/publikacii/2008/Ezegodnik2006.pdf (Rus)

This report is highly incomplete in terms of open data. 
Data for report collected from 688 stations from 249 cities (2015 year) but for report it's aggregated to sub-regional level and much lesser information for each city. 

Very limited data like "most polluted cities" and "average air pollution for regions" available at Voeinkov facility website http://www.voeikovmgo.ru/index.php/ru/struktura/otdel-monitoringa-i-issledovanij-khimicheskogo-sostava-atmosfery/laboratoriya-analiza-i-otsenki-sostoyaniya-zagryazneniya-atmosfery (Rus) but it's not open data and even not machine-readable data too. And it's incomplete, not all cities covered and no numeric data provided.

Also this data is not published in official Roshydromet repository - http://www.meteorf.ru/opendata/ (Rus) on it's official website

2. Second agency is "Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Welfare" (Rospotrebnadzor). 

This agency also collects data about water and air pollutants but it's network is even more "shadowed" than Roshydromet one. No data available at agency website http://rospotrebnadzor.ru/ (Rus) and it's official open data repository - http://opendata.rospotrebnadzor.ru/

I've visited every website of every facility owned by Rospotrebnadzor but no one provides not reports similar to Roshydromet report, not raw data. 


So requirement "Data should be available for all air monitoring stations or air monitoring zones in a country." is not matched for this data in Russia.

Disclaimer: I am founder of NGO "Informational Culture" and OKI Ambassador in Russia (member of OKI Russia core team). I have no any affilation with Roshydromet or Rospotrebnadzor.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Company information is available online free of charge on the Business Register of Slovenia website. However, data are behind a search mask, and one needs to register on the website in order to view the results (registration is free of charge). Name, Address, Registration Number, and Tax Number are available at a glance and once the entity name is selected, additional information including Status, Date of Entry into the Court Registry, Submission number, and information on shareholders among others are provided. Data are given in .HTML format, while one has the option to download the individual company information in .PDF, and cannot be downloaded in bulk.
It may be worth noting that the AJPES publishes the list of entities (as at 31. 12. 2016) enrolled in the PRS basic public data, which are available free of charge for reuse in XML format, and updated every three months, but this does not seem to include unique identifiers or addresses https://www.ajpes.si/Doc/Registri/PRS/Ponovna_uporaba/Prs.zip

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Data of Registered Entities with Unique Entity Number are available for free and downloadable in bulk on the Open Data portal in .CSV format, and .JSON via API. Data can be downloaded separately for Entities Registered with Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA) and Entities Registered with Other UEN Issuance Agencies in .CSV, or together in a .ZIP file. Data contain UEN Number, Issuance Agency, UEN Status, Entity Type, UEN Issue Date, Registered Street Name, and Registered Postal Code. They are updated weekly and are available under the Singapore Open Data Licence. According to the submitter, the dataset contains registration information not just for companies but also for schools, trade unions, and charities, among others. It's worth noting that in Singapore, the UEN is the identifier for registered businesses, so it's the search term that people would use when looking for company-related data. Furthermore, in Singapore each postal code refers to a specific building instead of a district. The dataset provides postal code and street name of each registered company where applicable. Lastly, all datasets on Data.gov.sg follow a tidy, machine readable format.

reviewComments: Submitted by reviewer.
details:
The Philippine Gazette provides some data regarding legal codes, government acts, and the like -- it does not provide any amendments regarding these laws. The data is not easily accessible, it is not downloadable but is considered to be free.  The website of the Philippine Gazette Journal is not organized to properly sort through the laws of the country.

Link to Philippine Gazette legal code example:
http://www.gov.ph/the-philippine-legal-codes/

There an alternative website that lists the laws, the non-profit Philippines Laws and Jurisprudence Databank. It is not affiliated with the government. The database contains the laws in HTML format with no official amendments.

Link: http://lawphil.net/

Finally, there is a private company that claims to sell comprehensive National Law data (data provided on a CD). It is a paid service that does not qualify as open data.

Link:
http://www.cdasia.com/laws-philippine-edition/

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Data are available free of charge on the Serbian Agency for Business Registers Search of Companies website. At a glance, Type of entity, Identification number, Business Name, and Status are given and once the "more details" option is selected, additional information including but not limited to Statistic Number, Legal form, Headquarters (Municipality, Place, Street Address), Date of establishment, and Tax Identification Number (PIB) number are provided. Among others, categories such as Address data, Business information, Legal representatives, branches, and Financial reports are available from a menu at the top. However, data are behind a search mask and one needs to know the name or identification number of an entity in order to find it. Data are also given in .HTML format and cannot be downloaded in bulk. The update frequency of the dataset is not known and neither is the type of license.

value: Forecast for current day and four following days

reviewComments:
There is an open data portal for weather observations (not forecasts). It allows to retrieve data such as wind speed, wind direction, humidity, air pressure, etc. This data can be downloaded as XLS files. The reviewer agrees that it was very hard to find the data portal in the first place (there is no direct link to the portal on the main website, and also no link when using the site-internal search engine. Only a link to a press announcement appears). Since the portal does not provide weather forecasts, it is not considered for the Index.

Forecasts are available for the current day for all characteristics (see here:http://www.hidromet.com.pa/pronostico_diario.php). One-week forecasts contain temperature and precipitation (downloadable as PDF here: http://www.hidromet.com.pa/pdf.php?dir=pronostico_extendido

There is a forecast for precipitation amount only, with a legend that explains what verbal descriptions of precipitation mean (e.g. strong rainfall = 25 to 75mm).

Since wind forecasts are not provided for current day and following two days, not all data is considered to be available online.

Thank you, Victor Díaz Navarro, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

The submission is correct. The given link (http://www.meteorologia.gov.py/mapa2.php) leads to written forecast reports for the current day +2 days. answers.value: Registro Público de Panamá / Public Registry of Panama

reviewComments:
Company data are collected by the Registro Público de Panamá / Public Registry of Panama. As mentioned by the original submitter, Victor Díaz Navarro, there are also two unofficial sources available:
http://www.panadata.net/sociedades and
http://www.panadata.net/personas
All three sources require registration. According to the submitter, all four characteristics are available online free of charge on the Public Registry of Panama website, however the dataset is not downloadable at once and one can only print and see the scanned document on .PDF format inside their platform. Again, according to the submitter, the data are up-to-date, though not openly licensed/in public domain. The submitter found the data by researching on the web for national registry, then entering the query platform, logging in and entering a captcha code, and searching by different criterias.  
In order to verify the submission, I too registered on the Public Registry website (https://registro-publico.gob.pa/index.php - registration is free of charge) and from the top menu selected Web Services -> Services and Registration which leads to Registry Services and Queries Interface (the link provided by the submitter):
https://www.rp.gob.pa/ValidacionDigital.aspx
Indeed, one needs to enter their username, password, and a captcha code in order to start a session. However, there appears to be a glitch on the page and it refuses to log in, stating that "either the username or password is not correct". Even after changing my password and using different browsers, the problem persists and it seems that there is no way for me to actually access the company data; if they are available at all. Hence, I am unable to verify that the dataset exists and have to reject the original submission.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
The Puerto Rico Department of State - Registry of Corporations and Entities website offers a Corporations and Entities Search feature where one can find company information for free by entering an entity's name or register number. Results include Registry number, Corporation Name, Class, Profit, Status, and once an entity's name is selected, Street and Mailing Address are also given. 
However, update frequency is not known and there is an announcement that the "Puerto Rico Department of State" does not warrant or guarantee the accuracy of information presented by this service. More specifically, "The content presented through this Portal is supplied by agencies and public corporations of the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico. Each of these agencies and corporations is solely responsible to ensure the currency, reliability, accuracy and veracity of the information they provide. The administrator of this Portal is not responsible for, and does not guarantee, updating, reliability, accuracy and veracity of the information contained herein." Data cannot be downloaded in bulk and another announcement informs that "the content presented by this Registry is ‘Public Information’ and the online services are intended for interactive participation. We reserve the right to block access to the site if we detect automated bulk data gathering tools. For business need of structured data feeds, please contact support@estado.pr.gov." Finally, the Portal contains information that is protected by copyright and author moral rights (http://estado.pr.gov/en/terms-of-use/).
details: A notification states that you can obtain bulk data by emailing support@estado.pr.gov..

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Data are available for free via the Company Search feature by the National Superintendency of Tax Administration (SUNAT) website which is in Spanish. However, one needs to know an entity's name or RUC (Single Taxpayer Registration number) in order to find it, as well as to enter a captcha code. Results are given in .HTML format and cannot be downloaded at once. Whether they are frequently updated is also unknown. At a glance, RUC, Name, Location (city), and State are provided. Once clicked on an entity's RUC, more information are available: Number of RUC, Type of Taxpayer, Tradename, Date of Inscription, Start Date of Activities, Taxpayer Status, Taxpayer's Status, Address, Proof of Issuance System, Accounting System, Economic activities, Proof of Payment, Electronic Emission System, Electronic Issuer since (date), Electronic Vouchers, Affiliated to PLE since (date), and Standards.
Please note that the website is not very cooperative. It crashes at almost every search request as well as almost every time a RUC is selected and shows either a message saying the page took too long to load, or a message saying "The application has returned the following problem: There were problems processing the query by ruc number. Action to be taken: Please try again to run the option, if you continue with the problem, contact our webmaster." Thus, one may need to submit their search query for a specific entity more than once in order to get (and then access the) results.

The Federal Gazette contains all other sorts of announcements, decisions, initiatives, etc. along with some bills. So the Content of the Bill could be found. The Author of the Bill could not be found (although the department to which the bill pertained was listed). The status of the bill could also not be found. Transcripts and votes were also missing. Since the dataset was missing two required characteristics and I couldn't find an alternate source, the original submission was rejected.

answers.commentValue:
For GDP, you have an option for "downloading complete tables" in a zip file containing a single .xls file with the entire dataset.
For unemployment, there's also a table in .xls with many sheets. One of them contains the whole dataset since the beginning of the survey (2012).
For population, there's a link (http://www.ibge.gov.br/home/estatistica/populacao/estimativa2016/serie_2001_2016_tcu.shtm) with the entire time series since the beginning of this survey (2001).

This is being done the 11th November. GDP quarterly data was updated until the second quarter, but not the third one (ended in september). Though we find it reasonable, since it will be updated in november. It is the normal delay in releasing this kind of data.
As for employment data, it was updated until september, which is also fair enough.
As for population, IBGE releases yearly estimates every 1st of July, for the current year. So, data for 2016 was already available.
I'm acquainted with this kind of data for at least 8 years, so it was really easy to me. Maybe it i not so easy for someone that doesn't work in the field.

answers.value: 1) Go directly to the IBGE webpage, 2) Search for "GDP", "Population" and "Unemployment", 3) recover the links from the respective surveys

answers.commentValue: I didn't find something as objective as a "terms and conditions" or a real license, but I found at this link a list of fundamental principles for official statistics with some guidelines for publication and dissemination. It contains the idea of data provided for public domain.

GDP data is collected through quarterly  national accounts system by IBGE (Brazilian Institute for Geography and Statistics), a federal public agency. They are also responsible for yearly population data (census and projections).
As for employment data, they stopped releasing the "Monthly Employment Survey - PME" in march 2016, which has replaced by the "Continuous National Household Sample Survey - Continuous PNAD" with employment and unemployment statistics in a monthly basis.
All data is provided in excel spreadsheets that are easy to work and analyze.

details:
The Antigua & Barbuda landfolio® Public Access Website has been provided by the Government of Antigua and Barbuda  to allow general public users, and other to search the government’s land records and retrieve information. Searches may be performed by parcel number, by instrument number, by party or owner name, by address, or by an interactive map. The information available includes physical parcel characteristics, ownership information, parcel transaction history, document images, aerial photographs, and comprehensive parcel reports.
However at the current time, public access has been limited to performing simple searches by parcel number and/or by instrument number. To access the map sign in is required

https://www.lands.gov.ag/landfolio.publicaccess.web/Contents/Search.aspx

answers.commentValue:
Appears the The State and National Parcel Data Working Group of the Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC), which is maintained by the Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Department of the Interior, is responsible for collecting land ownership data.  Upon reviewing the site, however, I could not find the data.

https://www.fgdc.gov/standards/projects/cadastral/index_html

The NAP site (https://www.nap.edu/read/11978/chapter/6#58) provides an excellent description of the FGDC and may also point to other potential data sources to be searched by the expert reviewer:

"As part of the FGDC, this subcommittee is charged with coordinating the interest in cadastral information of stakeholders at all levels of government. To support the coordination activities the subcommittee established an eastern and a western coordinator and steering committees. The committees focus on activities of regional concern as well as items of national interest. As discussed in Chapter 2, this subcommittee was instrumental in creating the content data standard for a modern land parcel data model. This standard is part of the Framework Content Data Standard, which is now going through its final approval at the American National Standards Institute level. Once approved, it will become an American National Standard applicable for adoption and use at all levels of government and industry."

Additional information: http://nationalcad.org/StateProgs/StateProgs.html



One final data source could be found under the "Statewide Land Ownership" listing here (https://navigator.blm.gov/data?keyword=fl_navMetric_ViewCount:*&sort=fl_navMetric_ViewCount%20desc).  However, it appears the link is broken.

reviewComments: According to the Federal Geographic Data Committee, the Cadastral Subcommittee is coordinating national cadastral and land records information [http://nationalcad.org].

It is openly licensed - see http://www.contractmapping.govt.nz/tools/privacy.html

answers.commentValue: I changed the submission to indicate that votes are not present. Although on the website there is a document called "National Assembly/Senate Votes" for each day the legislature was in session, I was actually not able to find a record of votes on these documents (just a summary of questions asked and Orders of the Day). Transcripts are available because the Hansard transcript for each day is provided (so by finding the day a bill was introduced, one can locate its debate on the Hansard of the day). Status of Bill is available on a separate page from the texts of bills. The page is called "Definition of Bills and Bill Status" and it contains a chart of all the bills that are currently under the legislature and their status. Author of bill is the respecting ministry that proposed the bill (in the case of government bills).

reviewComments: This submission should be accepted because all required characteristics are available in the data set.
details:
I made a few changes to the original submission.
1) Changed B3 to indicate votes were not available. 
2) Changed B5 to indicate data is not available in bulk
3) Changed B6 to claim that data is not up do date. This decision was made mainly on the fact that the last status update on bills was made a month ago. The original submitter also seemed to have noticed about a month delay in updates. This is more than the three weeks threshold of this survey.
4)Changed B8 to indicate that data is available in HTML.
See comments throughout. Despite the changes, I am accepting the submission because the required characteristics are  available (even though status is found on a different page and it was a bit more difficult to locate).

answers.commentValue:
According to the Freedom of Information Law the information that is published by institutions providing state functions is interpreted as "generally accessible information" that is compatible with the Public domain approach. The law does not require for the institutions to publish declarations or licenses with the information (they can be provided on voluntary basis).

The http://open.iub.gov.lv/ also says that this is an open data service and that there are no conditions for the reuse of this information.
The dataset uses a custom and very detailed XML data format that is described at http://open.iub.gov.lv/download/file/XML_strukturu_apraksts_v1.0.pdf
Downloads are broken down by date. In order to retrieve data covering more than one day you would need to retrieve multiple files but that can be done automatically.

answers.commentValue: National Assembly

I changed the original submission to indicate that the status of bills is available. Although the status of the bills is not made explicit it is easy to derive by looking at the document for each bill.  The PDF document for each bill includes all relevant documents for the bill as it moved through the legislative process. By looking at the versions of the bills available (and the resulting law if applicable) it is possible to determine where in the legislative process the bill is.

[Original Submitter Comment] Center for judicial documentation of the judicial body. 
[Reviewer comment] The original submission had also enteredhttp://www.organojudicial.gob.pa/cendoj/cendojfields/anteproyectos-de-ley/ as a source. While some bills could be found on this website, the database does not seem to be complete as the last bills that were recorded were from 2014. So I am using the website of the National Assembly to review the submission.

reviewComments: I am accepting the submission because all the required characteristics are available in the dataset.
details:
[Original submitter comment] Most drafts are available . The problem lies in the quality of the documents, which for some reason are sometimes printed, then scanned into PDFs and uploaded, rendering them unsearchable (document quality is also sometimes an issue).
[Reviewer comment] I was a bit flexible in choosing to mark status of bill as present. There was no explicit statement as to the status of the bill. However, the legislative history of the bill is documented in the PDF document for each bill. The document contains all the versions of the bill. Each version of the bill is preceded by a letter by the Speaker of the House/President of Panama/Author of Bill which summarize the legislative history of the bill up to a certain point. For those bill that have become laws, the PDF document concludes with the full text of the resulting law and the date it came into force. 
On the other hand, like the original submitter, I could not find the two optional characteristics (transcripts and votes). 
B5 was also answered YES with some flexibility. There is no option to download in bulk all the bills. However, for any given bill one can download all the data at once (so I made no changes to B5).

answers.value: Searched the Companies Commission of Malaysia website which redirected me to the e-Info service page.

value.descValue: Companies Commission of Malaysia e-Info Services

reviewComments:
The only available data the submitter could find for free was a list of number of registered companies and businesses according to months and categories such as local companies, foreign companies, total companies and total businesses:
http://www.ssm.com.my/en/statistic-total-business-companies
However, on the Companies Commission of Malaysia website there is the service "e-Info" available which is an internet based Self-Help Online System to provide search and purchase of company and business information. It is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, anywhere, globally by accessing www.ssm.com.my. A company profile which can be purchased via the e-Info system contains the following: Corporate Information, Registered and Business Address, Summary of Share Capital, Directors/Officers, Shareholders/Members, Company/Charges, and Company Financing Statement. A business profile which can be purchased via the e-Info system contains the following: Business Information, Current Business Owner, Nature of Business, and Business Branches:
http://www.ssm.com.my/en/product-services/e-info
Company Profile Information includes company name, company registration number and check digit, previous name and date of change, total authorized and total issued, directors, managers, shareholders, officers, company charges and summary of the latest financial information. Business profile information includes business name, registration number, type of business and detail of owner and partners, business address, date of commencement, and expiry date of current registration:
http://www.ssm.com.my/en/e-Info-Mainpage
All required characteristics are available via the service e-Info (https://www.ssm-einfo.my/) but for a fee of RM15 per Company. Once registered on the e-Info website, one can search for an entity via name or registration number and can then proceed to purchase the information in .PDF format. How often the data are updated is not stated. A sample can be seen here:
https://www.ssm-einfo.my/sample/sampleroc.pdf

reviewComments:
Names and Company Registration Numbers are available for free on the Central Registry of the Republic of Macedonia website: http://www.crm.com.mk/DS/Default.aspx However, these are available through a search mask so one needs to know the name or CRN of an entity in order to find it. Furthermore, as the original submitter, Arianit Dobroshi, pointed out on the date of submission (29/11/2016), there appears to be a technical glitch which does not show the full records, as intended. This issue is still not resolved on the date of the review (01/03/2017). Because of this, it is currently impossible to verify that company address is available. Hence, the original submission needs to be rejected as not all four characteristics could be found online.
Only Company Registration Numbers and Company Names in Cyrillic and Latin are given in .HTML format when searching for an entity's name. Clicking on a company's CRN does not provide any results. When searching for a company's CRN, entity size, status, and additional information (if applicable) are given but still no company address. Data cannot be downloaded at once.
http://www.crm.com.mk/DS/default.aspx?MainId=12
Data are not openly licensed; a notice at the bottom of the website sates: All data from the entries in the records published or available on the website of the Central Registry of the Republic of Macedonia can be used in the manner specified by the Law on the Central Registry or any other law solely for personal, non-commercial needs. The data can not be reproduced, published, distributed, modified, copied, sold, resold and / or abuse commercially in any way, in part or in whole, without prior approval from the Central Registry of the Republic of Macedonia.

value.descValue: PLACE Partial procurement awards yearly datasets

answers.commentValue:
Procurements data (both tenders and awarded contracts) is available as open data. However awards data only provides procurement from a portion of the central governmental entities (see here and here), estimated to represent only 40 to 60% of the global amount awarded each year.
The dataset on the last years procurement tenders is an extract of PLACE, the national procurement marketplace, still not mandatory and only including volunteer administrations (about 50%). It includes tenders name, description of the tenders and status of the buying unit, supplier name, award title, date of the notification (DAY/MONTH) city, zip code, value of the award, description of the award, if it was attributed to an SME.

Data on procurement tenders by some sub-national entities (city, departments, regions) and independant administrative authorities are generally not present on data.gouv.fr but there are some, such as CNIL and the City of Poitiers.

details:
I changed B2 to indicate that data was available without the need to register. The  original submitter had indicated that it is only available after registering. As the comment indicates the original submitter's decision was made on bulk downloads. Since bulk downloads are only a consideration for B5 I changed the submission, since texts of individual laws could be accessed without registration. 
I changed B3  to indicate that the dates of last amendments to laws and amendments were available. 
I changed B4 to YES because everything is free of charge. The original submitter's comment applies only to bulk downloads. 
In B8 I added that data is available for download in HTML and TXT format as well (in addition to XML). Before downloading a law, a dialogue box  appears asking in which format you prefer to download.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Data are available on the Jersey Financial Services Commission - Companies Registry website but through a search mask so it is necessary to know the name or registration number of an entity in order to find it. Name, Registered Office, Registration number, Registration Date, Law, Business Code, Business Type, Status are available online for free in .HTML format however the update frequency is not stated. One has also the option to order an entity's Certificate of good standing for £30.00, or a registration certificate for £4.00. 
If your search criteria are not specific enough you may find that the search engine takes some time to deliver a result. In order to ensure that all search results are delivered in a timely manner the system has been design [sic] to return the first 1000 results, they will be displayed showing the first 10 entries in Alphabetical order. You may change the order of your results by sorting them, either by double clicking on Number, Type or Name. You may also select to Show your entries 10, 25, 50 or 100 entries per page, you may also refine your results by using the additional search field that is available in your “Search Results” window. Should your result contain more than 1000 entries you will be required to refine your search criteria.
Data are not openly licensed (http://www.jerseyfsc.org/legal_information.asp) and can only be accessed as individual entities, hence they cannot be downloaded at once. However, a download of active companies registered under the Companies (Jersey) Law 1991, as amended, is available for a fee of £100.00. According to the website, it includes the company's current name, registration number and date of incorporation so perhaps the Company Address may be missing. If you require a download please contact the Registry at: registry@jerseyfsc.org.
Original submission by Masahiko Shoji. Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

This data is split into single reports per city.

reviewComments:
The submission is mostly correct. Some slight changes were made. 

Open license: the XML file contains a copyright note that reads as follows

"The content available in this file, including but not limited to all text, graphics, drawings, diagrams, photographs and compilation of data or other materials are protected by copyright. The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region is the owner of all copyright works contained in this website. Any reproduction, adaptation, distribution, dissemination or making available of such copyright works to the public is strictly prohibited unless prior written authorization is obtained from the Hong Kong Observatory." 

Since written authorisation is required, the data is not considered to be openly licensed (any use of data must be considered to be at the discretion of government).

Precipitation is also only fairly vaguely described ("Cloudy. Misty with one or two light rain patches at first"). Ideally precipitation amount should be published as a numerical value.

Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments: Original submission by Daniel Villatoro. Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
details:
There are no forecasts for two days. Therefore the data does not qualify for assessment.

Instead of a value, the Precipitation Probability is display with icons and descriptive text. 
The information is at 2 different URL's. One with a very general daily forecast, and the other about the current weather data in a more detailed output.  There's no forecast for the following days, instead they publish a weekly bulletin consistent of only descriptive text in a pdf format

Forecasts for precipitation are outdated and only describe weather for the following first day.

Weather forecast for current day are available at: http://www.insivumeh.gob.gt/meteorologia/bolpro.htm. Also a weather map is provided for the current day at http://www.insivumeh.gob.gt/meteorologia/mapatiempo.htm 

It could not be verified whether the data is in public domain, but it is likely not to given that where is an (outdated) copyright notice at the bottom of the page.

details:
The original submission was not accepted, because not all required data characteristics are available online. The website of the Meteorological and Hydrological Service, Republic of Croatia (http://meteo.hr/index_en.php), shows forecasts with temperature extremes, wind direction and precipitation for the current day and the following day. Forecasts for the third day are available in weather maps for wind speed and precipitation, but not for temperature. 
So there is no regional forecast for temperature for the third day. 

Copyright notice linked to the footer link states in Croatian:
MHS is the exclusive holder of economic rights, ie. Has the right to use all graphic and text features on the website regarding reproduction, copying performance, processing and putting them on the market .

reviewComments: Original submission by Ignacio Alfaro Marín. Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
details:
The original submission by Ignacio Alfaro Marín was not accepted because the data found online did not qualify. Forecast data is available from the Instituto Meteorológico Nacional at https://www.imn.ac.cr/en/web/imn/inicio. It should be noted that the Spanish version of the website could not be opened at the time of the review (date: February 28, 2017). 

The website provides temperature, cloud coverage, precipitation amount, and wind forecasts for the current day. Yet, forecasts are only made available for current day and the following first day, and include only some required characteristics.

Data is available in HTML, there is no download function. The data can be requested at https://www.imn.ac.cr/en/web/imn/solicitud-de-servicios, but it is not sure which data are provided through it.

reviewComments:
The INMEP states that public information can be republished freely. However, it becomes not clear whether weather data is public information or not. Also it becomes not clear whether data can be compiled or modified. Therefore it was answered that the data is not openly licensed.

Thank you, Wagner Faria de Oliveira, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
details:
There are two different data sources in this case. The data is not the same, though (if you search the same city in the two platforms, the results are different).
INPE is the National Institute for Spatial Research, associated to the brazilian Ministry of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications.
INMET is the National Institute for Meteorology, associated to the brazilian Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply.

Both links provide the same kind of information, but due to measurement differences, they are not exactly the same.
None of them offers files to download.

To make informational use, the platform displays data quite easily. But if you want to do anything more complex than that it is not possible because the data is not downloadable.

This year survey doesn't demand information on historical data but only forecasts.
For historical data, it is possible to retrieve information per measurement station, hourly, through the link http://www.inmet.gov.br/sonabra/pg_dspDadosCodigo_sim.php?QTUxMw==
Time series are provided in this link: http://www.inmet.gov.br/portal/index.php?r=estacoes/estacoesConvencionais
There is also a database that requires login and password to access it, but it is for free. You only have to register. It is called BDMEP (Banco de dados meteorológicos para ensino e pesquisa - Meteorological Database for Education and Research). The link is http://www.inmet.gov.br/portal/index.php?r=bdmep/bdmep

reviewComments:
Not all required data is considered to be uploaded online, because wind strength and direction are not included in the forecasts for the following two days.

The website contains verbal and iconic forecasts. The forecasts for "Oman Cities" are in HTML, well-structured and the icons embedded in HTML are named in a way that makes them easily understandable if automatically retrieved.

There is no download function. Some of the forecast icons (precipitation) make it hard to assess how much rain is going to fall (they are generic statements that rain is gonna fall).

There is only a copyright notification, but no open license. The terms of use are unclear. The data does not qualify as openly licensed.
details: Directorate General of Meteorology provides a lot of climate data to the public. The website has a section for providing simple weather details for specific cities in Oman and shows the temperature changes for the next three (not five) days for each city. ( http://www.met.gov.om/opencms/export/sites/default/dgman/en/weather-chart/oman-cities/index.html ) There is a section for historic data for the past 12 months. The website also has a more elaborate interactive map that allows the user to overlay different weather layers and playback the predicted changes for several future days. ( http://www.met.gov.om/opencms/export/sites/default/dgman/en/weather-chart/map-data/ ) The website is difficult to navigate and browsing by map is not intuitive and very slow. Also, the raw data does not appear to be available for download directly.

details:
The submission did not qualify for assessment, because no forecasts are available for wind speed and direction. 

The data is available at: http://weather.bg/0index.php?koiFail=RM2bulg1&lng=1. The data is stored as a PNG file embedded in the HTML code. Single elements (precipitation icons, etc.) cannot be individually scraped. Extensive human effort would be required to transcribe the data manually.

The data can only be used for private use:

reviewComments:
The submission is correct. The data is available on a website as weather map. The data is easily understandable and usable by humans. However, the data is only available in HTML and scraping is needed to automatically retrieve the data.

The data is not openly licensed. Also data services (such as embedding forecast widgets on third-party websites) fall under restrictive terms of use, and it is not allowed to disseminate the information contained on the website. See the terms of use here: http://www.meteo.be/meteo/view/nl/506883-Algemene+voorwaarden.html

After request, the team of http://opendata.meteo.be got back, reporting that currently an open weather data portal is being built. At time of the review the required data was not available on the portal.

Thank you, Bart Hanssens, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments: No further comments to add.
details:
The original submission was rejected because forecast data is not available for all required data characteristics. 

Current measurements and 24 hours forecasts are available in different heat maps at this URL: http://www.snet.gob.sv/ver/meteorologia/pronostico/pronostico+numerico/salidas+wrf/ These maps are not downloadable, and the heat map does not contain a legend that would explain the values. Forecast maps presenting precipitation symbols etc. are provided here: http://www.snet.gob.sv/ver/meteorologia/pronostico/48+horas/

The data is not downloadable, and data are scattered across the website. Significant human effort would be needed to transfer the data into a form to parse it. 

The copyright is unclear. There is a disclaimer at the footer of the website, stating "Todos los derechos reservados. 
El MARN permite la reproducción total o parcial de la información, 
agradeciendo de antemano consignar la fuente, así como su período de validez." However, the exact terms of use are not clear

The original submission was provided by The Next Services. Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments: No further comments to add
details:
The initial submission was amended. It stated that temperature extremes, averages, and precipitation are available online.

However, it was found that the Malawi Meterological Services provide 24h forecast for temperature extremes and cloud coverage/precipitation, wind speed and direction at http://www.metmalawi.com/weather/weather_24h.php as well as at  http://www.metmalawi.com/weather/5day_forecast.php. 

The forecasts are split into regions. 5-day forecasts are not separated into different days, but the website gives trends how the weather will develop in areas. Since the forecast is not very exact, not split into different days, and does not contain precipitation amount (at the date of review), it was decided that the submission does not qualify for assessment.

Thank you, Tricia Govindasamy, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Company Name, Address and Corporation Number are available to download at once for free in .XML and .CSV formats in a .ZIP file on the National Tax Agency Corporation Number Publication Site: "On this site, we provide the latest information on corporations publicly announced as of the end of the previous month as a data file of all cases, information specifying a new corporate number of newly established corporations, etc., the date of change and closing of trade name and location The following change information is provided as a difference data file." One can download differential data (nationwide) http://www.houjin-bangou.nta.go.jp/download/ or all data (by prefecture) http://www.houjin-bangou.nta.go.jp/download/zenken/ 
Corporate activity information (Notification information, recognition information, subsidy information, and procurement information held by the government) is also available for free in .CSV format on the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry - Corporate Info website. Data is downloadable at once and updated every end of the month http://hojin-info.go.jp/hojin/TopPage
Lastly, "any information published on the National Tax Agency corporate number publication site and on the website of the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) can be used freely, such as copying, public transmission, translation, transformation etc. Commercial use is also possible. In addition, since numerical data, simple tables, graphs, etc. are not subject to copyright, these usage rules are not applicable for these, so you can use them freely."
