reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
It seems that all four required characteristics are available online when registered with the business register and for a fee. The business register of the Italian Chambers of Commerce website (www.registroimprese.it) offers an online service to access information in .HTML format about the companies in the Italian Business Register. The service is available for companies and the general public, exclusively for demonstration and promotional purposes. The information is freely available and includes a company profile, limited to some basic company data. More specifically, the free company data produced by a name search consist in the following: Company name, Headquarters/ Registered Office address, Economic Activity (business purpose), Address and activity of the branch offices, Telephone and fax numbers, and E-mail address (when available) but not Unique Identifiers. This service cannot be used to search for cancelled, liquidated or insolvent companies. One can then chose to buy the standard company profile for 3,50 €:
https://www.registroimprese.it/richiedi-subito-documenti 
It appears that full company information including Unique Identifiers is available only when bought and if you register, since then you can make searches more structured and accurate, concerning also to branches and to closed companies, and consult not only the Italian Business Register, but also the Register of Protests and the archive of the Trademarks and Patents. Moreover, you'll have a larger choice of documents, also customized, i.e. containing only the information you need to. Registration is free of change however it requires an identification document such as an ID card, Passport, Driving License, Individual Tax ID number, or Health Insurance Card. Once registered, you can search for companies throughout the country, by name and province, by tax code and province, by REA number and province; or else you can also search for Individuals (only in the Italian Business Register) by name or by tax code. How often this data is updated and whether they can be downloaded in bulk is not specified.
https://www.registroimprese.it/visure-bilanci-protesti-ri.cerca-#page=page-1
The use of data obtained through the service at www.registroimprese.it must follow the current regulations about the handling of personal information (Legislative Decree 196/2003, as amended). To this end it should be noted that explicit consent from the recipient is required to use this information for advertising or direct sales, for market research or for commercial communications. It is also forbidden to redistribute and/or sell the data, to try to access the data for unauthorized purposes and, in particular, to perform massive batch extractions to speed up the activity or to create autonomous data banks.

I could not find any company data on the Open Data portal: http://www.dati.gov.it

A list of Companies is also available on the Commissione Nazionale per le Societa e la Borsa website, however this only includes Company name, Ownership, Share capital, Board members, New major shareholdings, and History, and not the Unique Identifier or Company Address.
http://www.consob.it/web/consob-and-its-activities/listed-companies

value.descValue: Registrar of Companies, Israeli Corporations Authority

reviewComments:
The original submission has been edited as the link to the Open Data portal provided by the submitter did not contain all four required characteristics.  More specifically, the file contains the list of companies registered in the Registrar of Companies administrator, with the exception of companies having been deleted. The .CSV file, which is updated every week, includes company name, company number and date of registration with the Registrar of Companies for free, but no company address. The database is updated every seven days and is available under open license:
https://data.gov.il/dataset/766

Still, I was able to find the Registrar of Companies, Israeli Corporations Authority website. Company Name, Number, and Address are available for free in .HTML format through a search mask so it is necessary to know the name of an entity in order to find it. However, data are not guaranteed to be up to date, cannot be downloaded in bulk, and the type of license is not specified.
http://havarot.justice.gov.il/

I also came across IsraelBizReg, an Israel Company Register service in English: "All information for the reports produced by IsraelBizReg are obtained from the Israel Companies Authority. This is the national body in Israel that is responsible for registering corporations and is the most accurate source of information on Israeli business. Our process involves requesting and paying for the appropriate documents and information from the Israel Companies Authority, formatting, and translation from Hebrew to English." Company Name, Location, and Registration Number are available for free in .HTML both in a list form as well as through a search mask where one needs to type in the name or registration number of an entity in order to find it. More detailed information can be purchased. How often the data are updated is not made clear, and neither is the type of license. The data cannot be downloaded at once.
https://www.israelbizreg.com/

The "Locating a Company" feature on the Ministry of Justice appears to be down - the page won't load.
http://www.justice.gov.il/En/Services/Pages/OnLineServices.aspx

A list of 662 Company Names is available on the Israel Export Institute - Catalogue of Member Companies. No Identification Numbers or Addresses are available.
http://www.export.gov.il/eng/companiesindex/.aspx?branch=&searchcompany=

A list of Public companies is available on the Israel Securities Authority website. Information include Company Name, Field, Register of Companies Number, Phone and Fax numbers, Website, but no Address. 
http://www.isa.gov.il/sites/ISAEng/Supervised%20Departments/Public%20Companies/Pages/List-Of-Companies.aspx

answers.value: Directorate General of Legal Administration (Direktorat Jenderal Administrasi Hukum Umum)

reviewComments:
The original submission has been rejected on the basis that not all four required characteristics are published online. 
According to the original submitter, the Indonesian company register is the most closed online available company register they've ever seen.
Though full company profiles are available on the Directorate General of Legal Administration (Direktorat Jenderal Administrasi Hukum Umum) website, they are not for free and not openly licensed. More specifically, the names and addresses of companies are available for free in .HTML format, but not their unique identifiers. Names and addresses are available through a search mask so it is necessary to already know the name of an entity in order to find it. In order to access a company's full profile (which one can only assume whether it includes the unique identifier), one needs to select the company of interest, fill in an online form, and buy the information through a pre-paid voucher. Information is then sent via e-mail in .PDF format. The update frequency is not known and the dataset cannot be downloaded at once:
https://ahu.go.id/pencarian/profil-pt

On the Ministry of Commerce - Company Directory Data Center Collection website there is a free list in .HTML format of Company Names, Addresses, and Products, but no Identification numbers are available:
http://www.kemendag.go.id/en/perdagangan-kita/company-directory/data-center-collection

On the Ministry of Industry - Business Directories website there is also a free list in .HTML format of Company Names, Addresses, and Commodity, but no Identification numbers are available:
http://www.kemenperin.go.id/direktori-perusahaan

reviewComments:
I could not find any relevant information of interest on the Official Gazette of the Islamic Republic of Iran website proposed by the submitter:
http://www.rrk.ir/

However, I was able to find through searching the Company Registration General Office website (sherkat.ssaa.ir/Default.aspx?tabid=4767), the Legal Entities' National ID Portal. Company data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name of an entity and submit it in Persian (not Latin characters) in order to find it. National ID, Registration, Name, Personality, Registrar, and Situation are available in .HTML format, but no Company Address. Yet, when clicking on the National ID of an entity, one is redirected to a .PDF which contains all information mentioned above as well as Legal Residence info. The document is in Persian. Update frequency of data is not known and data cannot be downloaded in bulk:
http://www.ilenc.ir/

The Tehran Chamber of Commerce and Industries and Mines Trade Directory also offers the Company Name, Manager Director, and E-Mail address of companies through a search mask in .HTML format, but not the unique identifier or company address:
http://dir.tccim.ir/english/

The original submission had to be rejected as not all four required characteristics can be found online. 
A list of companies, published in La Gaceta for dissolution, pursuant to article 6 of Law 9024, that contains entity names and ID numbers is available for free and downloadable at once in .XLS format on the National Registry website: http://www.rnpdigital.com/ http://www.rnpdigital.com/LISTADO%20DE%20EDICTOS.xlsx According to the submitter (originally submitted by Ignacio Alfaro Marín), one can buy company information on the National Registry website, which is the only public access online: https://www.rnpdigital.com/shopping/login.jspx Name, Unique Identifier, and Address of Costa Rican entities are available in a .PDF document sent to you when you buy it. In the online results one can only see the Name and Unique Identifier of the company in .HTML format, and data are not downloadable at once. However, accessing this information requires an account and is restricted with a captcha. I have been unable to verify the submitter's statements as the website does not make clear where one can register on the National Registry in order to buy/view the data; only the "sign in" option is available for those who already have a registered account. How often the data are updated is not specified, and the National Registry reserves, or holds for its own use, all the rights provided by copyright law (2013).

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Details of Indian Companies or LLPs incorporated and details of Foreign Companies or Foreign LLPs having established a place of business in India from November, 2013 onwards is available for free in .XLS format on the Ministry of Corporate Affairs website. Data include Corporate Identification Number (CIN), Company Name, Date of Registration, Month, State, Registrars of Companies (ROC), Class, Company Status, Company Type, Category, Authorised Capital, Paidup Capital, Activity Code, Activity Description, Registered Office Address, and E-mail.The dataset is updated monthly and downloadable at once:
http://www.mca.gov.in/MinistryV2/incorporatedorclosedduringthemonth.html
However, there is a copyright policy, "The contents hereof are the sole and exclusive property Ministry of Company Affairs ('MCA'), Government of India. Unless otherwise indicated and may not be, for whatsoever purpose, reproduced, stored, copied or archived in any manner, format or medium whatsoever either in full or in parts without the prior express written consent of MCA."
http://www.mca.gov.in/Ministry/pdf/MCAprivacypolicy.pdf

Data are also available for free online on the Open Data portal in .CSV format. They include Corporate Identification Number, Company Name, Date of Registration, Registered State, Registrar of Companies, Company Class, Company Status, Company Type,Company  Category, Authorised Capital, Paidup Capital, Registered Office Address, and Sub Category. However, the datasets are divided according to city/region so they cannot be downloaded at once. They are also outdated as they appear to be up to the 31st March 2015:
https://data.gov.in/catalog/company-master-data

reviewComments:
The original submission by Alesha Aris was amended. The dataset does not qualify for submission, because three-day forecasts are only available for precipitation amount (available at: http://hydromet.gov.gy/weather/forecast/). Other forecasts are available as PDF files in fair detail, see here: (http://hydromet.gov.gy/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/Weather-Brief-February-20-2017.pdf). These forecasts are valid for the coming 24 hours, are irregularly updated, and do not exist for the date of assessment (February 24, 2017). Other links are broken (see here: http://hydromet.gov.gy/weather/wrf-24-hrs-tendency/). 
Data can be requested via: http://hydromet.gov.gy/data-request/. 

Thank you, Alesha Aris, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
The data is very easily understandable, because all data (be it icons, or graphs) have a legend explaining the data clearly (so humans can interpret bar charts easily). However, the data itself is only available as PNG file embedded in HTML. So manual transcription is necessary to retrieve the data. To make the data usable through machines would require extensive effort.

Data cannot be downloaded. There is no open license on the website, but a copyright notification. The website states that one part of the business model is to cater numerical forecasts to private customers (see: http://www.dmi.dk/en/about/profile/introduction-to-dmi/#c5054). It does not appear that the data is in the public domain. Therefore it is not considered to be openly licensed. Thank you, Oscar Montiel, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

answers.commentValue: Current weather forecast updated every 3 hours is available here http://meteo.gov.mk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=84&Itemid=90&lang=en as open data however there is no 5 day forecast available.

reviewComments:
The submission was accepted and amended. The 3-day forecast exists, but only indicates minimum and maximum temperature as well as a general weather description (about cloud coverage). There is no indication of wind speed or direction. It could not be verified whether the general weather description describes precipitation amount. 

Forecasts for the current and following day are a slightly more informative. Weather maps show the wind direction and temperature (without any indication of measurement unit like Celsius). The data is embedded in HTML, but quite unprecise - the names of weather symbols are not self-explaining and do not indicate how much rain is falling in a region for example.

Besides that, the website contains highly outdated information (historical data from 2015) and there seems to be no consistent pattern how historical data is archived. Thank you, Arianit Dobroshi, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
The original submission was rejected as not all four dataset characteristics can be found online. More specifically, Company Names and CR numbers are available, but not Company Addresses.
One way to access data is through the Cyber Search Centre of the Integrated Companies Registry Information System (ICRIS). However, data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name of an entity in order to find it. Only CR No. and Company Name are provided. Data are free and in .HTML format, so they cannot be downloaded at once. There are also terms of use to which one must agree with as well as provide a reason for conducting the search in order to access the data. Update frequency is not stated:
https://www.icris.cr.gov.hk/csci/

There is also a list of old company names available for free in .PDF format. This provides neither a CR number nor a company's address:
https://www.icris.cr.gov.hk/csci/cnsResultLink.do

Final way of accessing data is through the Companies Registry by visiting data.gov.hk > Data Providers > Companies Registry. There is a List of Newly Incorporated /Registered Companies and Companies which have changed Names available for free, downloadable at once, and updated weekly in .XLS format. However, this also does not include company addresses, only CR numbers and Company names:
https://data.gov.hk/en-data/dataset/hk-cr-crdata-list-newly-registered-companies

There are also terms of use to which one must agree with as well as provide a reason for conducting the search in order to access the data. Update frequency is not stated:

There is also a list of old company names available for free in .PDF format. This provides neither a CR number nor a company's address:
https://www.icris.cr.gov.hk/csci/cnsResultLink.do

Final way of accessing data is through the Companies Registry by visiting data.gov.hk > Data Providers > Companies Registry. There is a List of Newly Incorporated /Registered Companies and Companies which have changed Names available for free, downloadable at once, and updated weekly in .XLS format. However, this also does not include company addresses, only CR numbers and Company names:
https://data.gov.hk/en-data/dataset/hk-cr-crdata-list-newly-registered-companies

answers.commentValue: No such datasets on their website. I sent an email but no response after 5days.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
The Ghana Revenue Authority (http://www.gra.gov.gh/) and the Registrar General's Department, Ministry of Justice and Attorney General (http://rgd.gov.gh/) websites contains no company data. Submitter had sent an email to the websites but five days later they had yet to receive a response. 
On the Public Procurement Authority website, under "Registered Suppliers and Contractors", one can search for Suppliers, Contractors and Consultants  which are registered currently with the Public Procurement Board in Ghana (http://www.ppaghana.org/suppliersearch.asp). One can chose the company name from the drop-down menu, rather than by typing it in so in that sense, one doesn't need to know the name of an entity in order to find it. Alternatively, one can simply request "search" with all fields marked as "all" and a list with all companies will come up over several pages in .HTML format. Once clicked on an entity's name, one can see information including Company Registration number, Postal, Web, and E-mail Addresses, Telephone and Fax numbers, category, sector, products, and contact person. However, the list probably does not contain all Ghanaian companies as after looking for specific entities such as AngloGold Ashanti, Accra Brewery Company, and Aluworks, I could not find them. Hence, I am accepting the original submission and conclude that the required dataset was not available online.

value.descValue: 3-day forecast - Weather map with text description of wind speed (for several regions)
Forecast for current day - XML file

reviewComments:
Forecast are primarily available as weather maps. The data must be scraped, and even then it lacks detail to make it fully understandable. The data is embedded in HTML, presented in text form or weather symbols. Looking at the source code, some symbols can be interpreted by their name (e.g. wind direction). Cloud symbols show the amount of precipitation but there is no indication how much rain is falling precisely. The actual amount of rain cannot be understood from the symbol, if it would be scraped.  Given that the data is embedded in HTML, the submission was changed.

There is no download for forecasts available. Data for the current day can be retrieved as XML.

Wind speed and direction are available for large regions in the country (no local forecasts) and are verbally described (strong winds can occur in region X). 

The submitter correctly stated that "copyright is claimed in the footer, "Copyright 2006. HMI of Montenegro".  A regulation on the database of HMI data does not mention their status http://www.meteo.co.me/zakoniipravilnici/Pravilnik%20o%20sadrzaju%20jedinstvene%20baze%20podataka%20o%20stanju%20vremena,%20klime%20i%20voda.pdf" 

Data can be requested based on FOI law see guidance document (MNE) http://www.meteo.co.me/Vodic1.pdf and request form http://www.meteo.co.me/Request.pdf

The original submission  was sent by Arianit Dobroshi. Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

answers.value: The Office of the Registrar of Joint Stock Companies and Firms

reviewComments:
Original submission was rejected as no data could be found online. The Office of the Registrar of Joint Stock Companies and Firms is the sole authority that keeps records of all registered entities (companies, trade organizations, societies and partnership firms). Any one can apply for certified copy of any of such records of an entity. However, the profit & loss account of a company is not open to all. Only authorized personnel of the respective company can apply for it. On receipt of an application and requisite fee, RJSC issues certified copy of the records applied for. One applies for certified copy of record (s) through the website. Certified copies are issued for Private, Public, and Foreign Companies, Trade Organizations, Societies, and Partnership Firms. However, what company information the copies of records include is not made known, the update frequency of the data is also not stated, and whether the data records are made available online after purchase is also not clear.
http://roc.portal.gov.bd/site/page/c3662525-9229-45a4-a80c-2e518d484c52

Superintendencia de Compañías, Valores y Seguros

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
The Superintendencia de Compañías, Valores y Seguros website offers a variety of options to access information. Of interest are the "Search for Companies" (Busqueda de Companias), "Directory of Companies" (Directorio de Companias), and "Directory of Companies Summary" (Directorio de Companias Resumido). The first option provides data through a search mask, and it is necessary to know the name, record/case file, or identification number of an entity in order to find it. Results are then viewed in .HTML format. The "Directory of Companies Summary" also has a search mask but one does not need to know the name of an entity in order to find it: choosing "search" with all fields marked as "all" returns results. Of most interest is the "Directory of Companies" option which offers a list of entities without any search requests. Data can be viewed online by scrolling through several pages, however one is given the option of viewing and downloading the data at once in .HTML, .PDF, .XML, .XLS, or .CSV formats. Information includes Record/Case File, Tax Identification Number (Ruc), Name, Address, State, Branch, Economic Activity, Telephone and Fax numbers, and Web address where applicable. Data are available for free, although the type of license is not made clear. I also could not find how often or when the data were last updated.

answers.commentValue: The reason why the Gazette was chosen as the point of reference for this review is because it makes a much clear connection between a law and its amendment. The laws published on the Assembly website  do not list the amendments nor their dates. Amendments appear as separate laws altogether. The Gazette however clearly lists the laws amending the original law and the date of enforcement. So all requirements are met on the Gazete website.

Texts of laws can be found on both websites. However, as a reviewer I am adding  the second URL of the Official Gazette. I will use this website instead for the rest of the review as it contains more complete data.

reviewComments: I am accepting the submission as it meets all required characteristics.
details: The  review was based on the Gazette website. The original submitter used the Assembly website and made no mention of the Gazette (I added this source as a reviewer). I am much more confident that all the characteristics are found when taking the Gazette as a point of reference. The Assembly data  is relatively incomplete as it does not note amendments on original laws (even though amendments are still published separately).  The other change I made was in B8, where I noted that data is available in TXT format (in the Gazette).

answers.commentValue:
[Comment by original submitter] Israeli laws are public domain by law, however, the license on the Knesset website does not acknowledge that. 
[Comment by reviewer] The original submission indicated that the data was openly licensed giving the rationale noted above. I am changing this to a NO. There is no indication on the website that the content is in the open domain. The URL (http://main.knesset.gov.il/About/Pages/Copyright.aspx) provided in the original submission states: "User may make "fair use" of the protected material as set out in the law, as well as a quote from the protected material in a reasonable manner". In addition, the bottom of the page makes a copyright claim to ”All rights reserved to the State of Israel - the Knesset or to third parties, as set out in midfield". The original submitter, other than generally stating that laws are in public domain provided no other convincing proof. The proof from the website indicates that the content is not in the open domain. Since for the purpose of this survey we are strictly concerned with online content, I am changing B7 to NO.
The laws themselves only available in PDF
Laws and amendments are updated up to February 2017.

They only claim to offer the opportunity to search registered companies by name. But the service is not available: http://www.camarasantodomingo.do/red-empresarial/busqueda/
However, I was able to find information online for free on the National Office of Industrial Property (ONAPI) website: http://onapi.gob.do/busqueda-consulta.html

answers.commentValue: URL: http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/sesion-plenaria/votaciones-electronicas

reviewComments: The original submission was rejected because two required characteristics were absent from the dataset. The current submission now indicates that "Data is not available."
details:
The original submission was rejected because two required characteristics are notavailable. Content of bill is missing. Status of the bill is also missing. 
There is no way to search for a given bill. The only way to get an indication of bills being discussed is by looking at the archives of Legislative sessions since 2009 (which are listed chronologically) (
http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/sesion-plenaria/votaciones-electronicas). For each legislative session they provide a summary of the items discussed in the legislature on the day. The names of bills are mentioned, but not their content or the ensuing debate. Votes on bills per member of parliament and the author of a bill can be found on two separate documents “Electronic Voting” and “Correspondence”, respectively. It is worth mentioning that these documents provide an aggregate summary of all the items voted on/or introduced in the legislature on that day. They can only be found under the record of legislature proceedings for a given day. 
The original submission had indicated that Votes on Bills and Status of Bills was available. However, even though some information is available as to the votes on bills and the authors, the information is not very useful as they are presented without context (other than the fact that the bill was introduced/voted on on a specific date). This information would be extremely difficult to find without knowing the date a particular bill was discussed or voted on in front of the legislature. Status of bills on the other hand could not be found at all. 
The  original submission also indicated the following:
- Downloadable at once: No
-Up to date: No
-Open license: No
-Readable format: No

reviewComments: The original submission was rejected because not all characteristics could be found. The previously published review was updated in order to accurately indicate that data is not available.
details:
The original submission provided the URL for the Senate website (http://senado.gob.bo/legislativa) in addition to the website for the House of Deputies (www.diputados.bo/index.php/leyes/leyes-en-tratamiento). Although some data can be found on the Senate website, I used the website of the Deputies to review and score the submission because the Senate website provides very limited information. The Deputies website, however also covers the Senate (so in other words data for the Senate could still be found).
The author of the bills (a required characteristic) could not be found and so B2 was answered with "No" and original submission was rejected. It is also worth mentioning that two optional characterstics: Transcripts on Bills and Votes were also missing.
On the other hand two required characteristics could be found on the Deputies website: Content and Status of bills.
The following apply to the available data only:
-Free of charge: yes
-Downloadable at once: no
-Up to date: yes
- Open domain: no 
- Format: PDF only. The original submission indicated that the data could be found on HTML. However, I changed this part of the submission because I could not find it on HTML. The only thing that is in HTML format 					 is a very short summary of the bill. The actual bills are only available in PDF format.

reviewComments:
The initial submission was accepted, but with minor changes. More direct links to the data were added, to show where the data can be found. 

Findability:
The website was fairly easy to find (first google result, when querying "weather forecast data Australia". The website displays "data  services" on the homepage. Two clicks further users can find the FTP access page. It was a bit hard to understand that the required data are available without registration. The meteorological service provides various entry points to the data, and it was not immediately obvious which one to take for the assessement.

Data from the FTP server  is available for free, as stated here:  http://reg.bom.gov.au/reguser/

Bulk: 		 				
The data is separated per districts (including forecasts for several towns per district). Each file contains data over a certain timeframe, including all cities / towns of a district. There is a fair amount of data split across files. But the data can be directly addressed because they use consistent identifiers: 
“Files are overwritten with each issue and file names are unchanging allowing for direct addressing.” See here: http://reg.bom.gov.au/catalogue/textforecasts.pdf
Therefore the data can count as bulk.

However, the data is usable for private use, redistribution is not allowed. Therefore the data is not openly licensed.

The original submitter indicated to be a "national manager of weather services". Thank you for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

details:
The original submission was rejected. It referred to a website of the Namibia Weather Network. As the website itself states, the Network "is an affiliation of professional personal weather stations located in Namibia. This website is neither affiliated with nor endorsed by the Namibian Meteorological Service or any other government agency." It receives its data from Yr, the Norwegian Meteorological Institute.

The WMO lists the Namibia Meteorological Service as the official government agency. The official website is http://www.meteona.com.

Forecast data is available, but is was outdated. Clicking on forecasts for today and tomorrow (date February 20) users get to the same forecasts. These include wind strength and direction. Forecasts for today and the two following days do not contain information on wind. The data therefore does not qualify for the Index.

The data cannot be downloaded and is only available in written text or icons. The data is embedded in HTML, but icons do not have an adequate naming, to be easily interpretable, when being scraped.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index. However, information on online data availability and data update frequency has been updated.
Information on company data are available on the website FUNDEMPRESA, a non-profit foundation that operates the Trade Registry of Bolivia (Concesionaria del Registro de Comercio de Bolivia). On the home page there are links in the sidebar on the left ("Consulta de Empresas") that redirect to query forms in the form of a pop-up window (http://www.fundempresa.org.bo/). Although the data are free of charge, they are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know an entity's name, business registration number, tax identification number, or operating license consultation in order to find it. The data include company name, registration number, legal and commercial address, operating license, phone number and e-mail address. The additional options of legal information (constitution and amendments, legal representatives, partners, kardex) and financial information also appear but if selected, the access is denied and one needs to be registered in order to access it. The data are in .HTML format and not downloadable at once as only one entity at a time can be viewed. Update frequency is not made known. FUNDEMPRESA holds all the rights provided by copyright law (2011).

reviewComments:
The submission was changed, because 5-day forecasts are an optional data characteristic. Required are forecasts for the current day and the 3 following days. 

Usability of data: The data of city forecasts, available at: http://www.cambodiameteo.com/forecast?menu=116&lang=en&day=undefined&areaid=12 are fairly easy to understand for humans (using icons). However there is no legend to interpret them. It is hard to derive the precipitation amount from the icons  (checking the HTML code shows the names of the icons. These give some indication what the icons mean ("slight rain")). Scraping is needed to make data usable.

The forecast data is represented as icons (png) embedded in HTML code. Since they can be individually addressed (and have a clear naming) it was accepted as HTML. Data cannot be downloaded at all. 

Also there are neither an open license, nor terms of use displayed. It could not be verified whether data is in the public domain or not.

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.
Bhutan's Company Registry Division falls under the Department of Industry, Ministry of Economic Affairs. Its function involves:
- Implement the provisions of the Companies Act of the Kingdom of Bhutan, 2000
- Formulate and enforce rules and regulations to implement the Companies Act
- Monitoring of companies
- Enforcement of Enterprise Registration Law upon adoption by Parliament
- Provide legal services to the Ministry
- Provide legal advice and guidance to the companies.
However, there are no data available on the Ministry's webpage and only the Company Registry's office number (http://www.moea.gov.bt/departments/contactus.php?id=2) and list of staff are provided (http://www.moea.gov.bt/who/whoiswho_division.php?divid=61&unit=2). reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index. 
Information on Federal Corporation is available through Industry Canada (current organization name: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada) on Canada's Open Government portal under the Open Government Licence - Canada. Data are freely available online in .XML format and can be downloaded all at once in a single .ZIP file. They contain information such as company name, identification number, and address, and are updated on a weekly basis. However, the dataset does not include information about corporations created under financial legislation (such as financial institutions, insurance companies or loan and trust companies) or those created under provincial, territorial or other corporate legislation. The dataset provider has not responded as to where such information can be found.

reviewComments:
The initial submission was altered. Precipitation is provided, but not as numerical values. It is only shown as verbal indications such as ("there can be sporadic showers"). Wind speed is contained in an XML file, but no wind direction, which is only provided in verbal form here: http://fhmzbih.gov.ba/latinica/PROGNOZA/P-trodnevna.php

Information is split across pages, and stored in different data types (numbers, text, icons without legend) which makes it harder to retrieve a comprehensive overview of the data. Also since not all data is provided in XML, the data is not considered to be fully machine-readable.

The Federal Hydrometeorological Institute shows © 2001-2016 
(under the menu http://www.fhmzbih.gov.ba/latinica/PROGNOZA/P-klima.php))

The data cannot be modified, and can only be used after agreement of the institute. Therefore the data is not compliant with the Open Definition (data must be modifiable) http://fhmzbih.gov.ba/latinica/O-NAMA/FHMZ-uslovi.php

Usability of data: 
XML data is easily usable, but contains empty fields for precipitation amount. Precipitation icons on this webpage are consistently named and can be scraped, but there is no legend that makes them interpretable.  

Thank you, Arianit Dobroshi, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
The submission was altered as follows: 

More links to the data were added. There are two websites presenting forecast data. 

Data is considered to be downloadable at once, since forecasts for all reuqired information can be downloaded as PDF. However, the forecasts are fairly unprecise, meaning that the PDF file only contains verbal descriptions of wind direction and strength ("strong wind from southwest)" as well as precipitation amount (strong precipitation).   

Data usability: Temperature data is published in HTML. PDF contains all required data. It is not obvious whether the PDF follows a consistent structure. Therefore I agree with the initial submission that extensive effort would be required to parse information.

Data cannot only be used for informational or private purposes, after the right to reuse the data has been granted by the agency. The data is therefore not compliant with the Open Definition's claim for unrestricted reusability.

Thank you, Aleksandar Ivić, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

I couldn't obtain data in machine readable format as demanded by the methodology, only in PDF and for visualizing plotted in an online map. .XLS and. SHP files could be obtained for the Amazon Region, but it is not per air monitoring station, not for all pollutants and it is outdated.

The dataset is not downloadable. All data is available for visualization in the web (first link) or in a report in pdf. The only link that permits data download in the third, which is only for the Amazon Region.
Data provided by the MMA is from 2012. The real time data in the map from INPE doesn't show the values, So I didn't consider here for this question.
Information is very disaggregated, it took me a lot of time to come with all these links I found, and I had to ask a specialist for help.

answers.value: 1) Search in google for pollutant emissions data in Brazil, but this was not very successful; 2) Ask a specialist for more information; 3) Come with the INPE website where I found most of the information; 4) Search for information in the Ministry of Environment website; 5) Look for insights in 2015 index to compare; 6) Look for more information in other administrative levels; 7) Aggregate information to see what was more relevant.

answers.commentValue:
The link is not for a license, it is the same link provided for the report from MMA. In its page 5 it says that Federal Law nº 10.650/2003 required that the National System of Environment published yearly reports on air quality, being compulsory its publication in official internet websites.
As for data from the Amazon Region, from INPE, there is "other" attribution license, as can be seen at this link: http://dados.gov.br/dataset/inpe-em/resource/6ec5237b-dc27-4489-8ad2-17ff7548dbf6
The comprehensive data is available only in PDF format or in a plotted dynamic map on the web, so the data is not at all ready to use.

answers.value: Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE); Ministério do Meio Ambiente (MMA)
answers.commentValue: Information on this topic is disaggregated in many different sources. I listed here the two main sources that I found. INPE (roughly translated as National Institute for Spatial Research) is a government agency of the Ministry of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications and MMA is the brazilian Ministry of Environment.

I found all the information required per air monitoring station in the document from MMA (the second link) above, but it is on .PDF format and it is outdated (2012). Information in real time (the first link) is not available per air monitoring station and is missing for Sulphur oxides.

Reviewer: No data found on NOx in the quality required.

Statistical series by IBGE on emissions of some pollutants per metropolitan region. Downloadable in .xls format, but outdated.
Weekly Report on air quality monitoring by the Federal District Government. In PDF only for two pollutants. Subnational level.
Real Time data on air quality monitoring by the State Government of São Paulo. No download option, only for six pollutants. Subnational level.

answers.commentValue: Here I listed not only the two main sources I'm using but all the other relevant information I found, from other sources. I included subnational level links as examples of better practices beyond the Federal government.

reviewComments: Accepting Submission, on the basis made by the Local Researcher. Made some corrections on the available data and the note of lack of direct license being described with the data.
details:
As I said before, there are many different sources of pollutant emissions data in Brazil, but any of them seems to comply with the methodology of the open data index.
I would just  like to point out some of the information I could get apart from what  I focused during the process of filling the survey.
1) All information of the MMA can be obtained through this link: http://www.mma.gov.br/cidades-sustentaveis/qualidade-do-ar
2) In August 2016, the MMA complied with the creation of a transparency platform for pollutant emissions data, but it is not yet available.
http://www.brasil.gov.br/meio-ambiente/2016/08/sistema-nacional-traz-transparencia-aos-dados-de-emissao-de-poluentes
3) Data on pollutant emissions by vehicles since 1980 until 2012 is also published in pdf format by the MMA:
http://www.mma.gov.br/images/arquivo/80060/Inventario_de_Emissoes_por_Veiculos_Rodoviarios_2013.pdf
4) INPE produces the map (http://meioambiente.cptec.inpe.br/index.php?lang=pt) but also information on the Amazon region downloadable in .xls format (http://inpe-em.ccst.inpe.br/), which is also available in the brazilian open data portal (http://dados.gov.br/dataset/inpe-em/resource/6ec5237b-dc27-4489-8ad2-17ff7548dbf6)
5) IBGE used to have periodic research on emissions, but it seems to be outdated for most of the metropolitan regions (http://seriesestatisticas.ibge.gov.br/series.aspx?vcodigo=IU5&t=concentracao-poluentes-ar-areas-urbanas-1)
6) This kind of data has better quality in the subnational level. I put here two examples I found, which is from the Federal District (http://www.ibram.df.gov.br/informacoes/meio-ambiente/qualidade-do-ar.html) and from the State of São Paulo (http://sistemasinter.cetesb.sp.gov.br/Ar/php/boletim_por_poluente.php). There should be a kind of aggregation of subnational level data.

reviewComments:
As for findability, 2016 Legislative Council results are visible and straightforward. On the other hand, finding historical results can be challenging, although easily findable through Google search queries.
Both the Registration and Electoral Office website and the elections dedicated site contain Copyright disclaimers. The first one states that “content available on this website, including but not limited to all text, graphics, drawings, diagrams, photographs and compilation of data or other materials are subject to copyright owned by the Registration and Electoral Office ("REO") or other entities. Except as expressly permitted herein or where prior written authorization is obtained from the REO, any reproduction, adaptation, distribution, dissemination or making available of such copyright works to the public is strictly prohibited” (http://www.reo.gov.hk/en/notices/notices.htm). The elections website explains that  “unless otherwise indicated, the materials found on this site are subject to copyright owned by the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. Permission is required in adopting, reproducing or redistributing photographs, graphics, and audio and video files on this website. Visitors are permitted to download, print, make copies of and distribute all other information on this site for personal or educational purposes, subject to the following conditions: 1. the copy or copies made must not be for re-sale or commercial distribution purpose; 2. the materials must be reproduced accurately; 3. the source of the materials must be identified and the copyright status acknowledged.” (http://www.elections.gov.hk/ce2017/eng/important.html)

reviewComments:
The submission stated that no evidence could be found that a government entity collects meteorological information. The World Meteorological Organisation states that the Botswana Meteorological Services are providing this information: see here https://www.wmo.int/cpdb/botswana.

However information on this agency is almost not existing on the WMO website and it is not clear what the exact tasks of the agency are, and whether it shares responsibilities (i.e. provision of data for aviation, or similar).

The WMO links to a website hosted by IBIS. It could not be verified whether it is a data provider contracted by government or not.  

Therefore the submission counts as valid. Thank you, Tricia Govindasamy, for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

details:
The submission was rejected because weather forecast data does not meet all required data.  Weather forecast data is available for current day plus four following days for: temperature extremes, as well as precipitation amount. Precipitation amount is described verbally ("brief scattered showers" or similar).

No wind data is provided as forecast data. The data is hosted on the website as HTML, and cannot be downloaded. 

Longer-term forecasts (several months) for precipitation can be downloaded as pdf files showing rain distribution on a heat map.

The submitter stated that data was quickly findable, through a google search, as well as on the websites of the meteorological service. The reviewer can confirm this.

The original submission was made by Alesha Aris. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

reviewComments:
The original submission was amended, because it referred to current weather measurements (containing all required data elements for various weather stations in numerical values, it is openly licensed, available for free, downloadable at once). This data is fully open. However, it is not forecasting data.

The reviewer found a forecasting dataset, available at:
http://www.zamg.ac.at/cms/de/produkte/wetter/allgemeine-vorhersagen/wetter-fuer-ihre-homepage-und-mobile-anwendungen

This dataset contains all required characteristics for 5 days and is considered the reference forecast dataset, because it is most representative for the parameters the Index assesses. It can be retrieved at once via FTP server but is not openly licensed and has to be  paid on a monthly basis. To do so, users have to sign up for the service. It is available as HTML or in raw data (XML or CSV). 

I added the characteristics "precipitation amount" and "precipitation probability"

Thank you, Günther Tschabuschnig, for submitting to the Global Open Data Index.

details:
The original submission was reject because the website of the Bangladesh Meteorological Department does not display forecast data.

reviewComments:
Historical data from elections, such as parliamentary, regional and referendums, are available and easily findable through the website. reviewComments:
The submission was partly correct. Following changes have been made: 

The data is indeed openly licensed. If users want to download forecast data, they need to accept terms of use. It is stated that all web content is provided under the Attribution 2.5 Argentina license, see explanations to the license here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/ar/deed.en

Besides a data download data is accessible and presented in many formats: as detailed weather forecasts for the current day, available through a search mask, or as forecast maps. These maps are not interpretable, because the scales are missing a legend. So precipitation amount cannot be easily understood.

The initial submission answered all questions correctly. The submission was still rejected, because the weather forecast data does not meet the dataset characteristics the Index wants to assess: 
There are no data on precipitation amount for the current day and the following two days.

Forecasts of temperature extremes, wind speed (in km/h) and direction (indicating cardinal directions and more: ESE - SE) are available for current day and following three days, all in numerical values. 

However, the forecast does not indicate precipitation amount. Precipitation probability is  described verbally as  "slt chnce of shwr". 

The data is available for the entire island (one aggregated national forecast). This forecast shows precipitation amount, wind speed, wind direction (for example: ESE - SE)  as well as temperature extremes. 

There is no download function, but the data is presented comprehensively in one table in HTML. 

The data is easily findable because the homepage directly links to forecasts, and 4-day forecasts (links are named accordingly). 

There is a copyright disclaimer on the website, but no specification of terms of use or similar could be found. There is no open license presented online. It could not be verified whether the data is in the public domain or not.
details:
The initial submission answered all questions correctly. The submission was still rejected, because the weather forecast data does not meet the dataset characteristics the Index wants to assess: 
There are no data on precipitation amount for the current day and the following two days.

Forecasts of temperature extremes, wind speed (in km/h) and direction (indicating cardinal directions and more: ESE - SE) are available for current day and following three days, all in numerical values. 

However, the forecast does not indicate precipitation amount. Precipitation probability is  described verbally as  "slt chnce of shwr". 

The data is available for the entire island (one aggregated national forecast). This forecast shows precipitation amount, wind speed, wind direction (for example: ESE - SE)  as well as temperature extremes. 

There is no download function, but the data is presented comprehensively in one table in HTML. 

The data is easily findable because the homepage directly links to forecasts, and 4-day forecasts (links are named accordingly). 

There is a copyright disclaimer on the website, but no specification of terms of use or similar could be found. There is no open license presented online. It could not be verified whether the data is in the public domain or not.

details:
I have made no changes to the submission, with the exception of the comments on the side which provide some more details on the findings. 
Full texts of the national laws with amendments were available on both the SILEP site and the Gaceta Oficial. The SILEP site was easier to navigate and displayed amendments more clearly. But Gaceta was the one that was regularly updated, while SILEP was out of date.  The SILEP site makes it clear that the Gaceta should the authority on national laws publications. It states: "IMPORTANT:
LAWS SHOWN ON THIS WEBSITE ARE THE RESULT OF REGISTRATION AND UPDATING AND EXPRESS REPEALS Repeals ADOPTED BY THE LEGISLATIVE BODY FROM 1825. HERE DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED IN ANY WAY THEY CAN NOT BE USED AS LEGAL REFERENCE, AS SUCH ALLOCATION APPLICABLE TO THE GAZETTE STATE OFFICER."
It is possible that SILEP provides updated information only to registered users. It advises visitors to register in order to stay more up to date with the laws.

details:
This is a new portal for new registry, which unites several other registries used in the past.

The bad news is, that it is available only in in human readable form, i.e. via Search Form (search possible based on ID number, name of the subject, etc.) and results are available as HTML.

The good news is that data is licensed under CC-BY (as stated on the front page of portal) so other non-government project(s) are scrapping the data and are making it available in machine readable form (for example https://ekosystem.slovensko.digital/otvorene-data#rpo).

reviewComments:
The Zambia Meteorological Department (ZMD) produces weather (forecast) data. It is affiliated to the Ministry of Transport, Works, Supply and Communications. The ZMD holds a database with historical data as current data on temperature, precipitation and other items (see here: http://www.zmd.gov.zm/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=63&Itemid=65)

The ZMD bundles these data into several services such as Crop Weather Bulletins (presenting precipitation amount in different regions of Zambia) This service is not updated. 

Also a 7-day weather forecast is provided. However, the forecast describes forecasts verbally and vaguely (slightly clouded, some rain expected). It does neither offer data on temperature, nor on wind speed.
The relevant data are therefore not provided online.

answers.commentValue:
The data are provided as paid services. Details can be found at: http://www.meteo.gov.gh/website/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=37&Itemid=56#

The charge is made dependent on the use case of the data. It seems that commercial applications are charged more than non-commercial ones, but there is no price list to see the pricing models.

A user must email the agency with details of what exactly they need as stated on this website: http://www.meteo.gov.gh/website/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=54:how-do-i-apply-for-meteorological-data-from-meteorological-agency&catid=36:faq-items&Itemid=55.  The include online form link was not working as  of January 19th, 2017 as 5;55 am GMT

reviewComments:
The submission is correct. Weather data are provided as paid services. Details can be found at: http://www.meteo.gov.gh/website/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=37&Itemid=56#

The charge is made dependent on the use case of the data. It seems that commercial applications are charged more than non-commercial ones, but there is no price list that would enable verifying pricing models. 

It was not possible to verify if forecasts for several days are provided.

A user must email the agency with details of what exactly they need as stated on this website: http://www.meteo.gov.gh/website/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=54:how-do-i-apply-for-meteorological-data-from-meteorological-agency&catid=36:faq-items&Itemid=55.  

A link to a request form was available, but not working as of January 19th, 2017 as 5;55 am GMT. Another try on February 10th, 2017, 1.30pm GMT brought similar results.

Court Register - Ministry of Justice, Republic of Croatia

reviewComments:
Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index, your submission is valid.

The court Register (Croatian Ministry of Justice) is public and everyone, without proving legal interest, shall have access to data recorded in the general ledger. All 4 required characteristics were found online: Croatia's companies' names, addresses, MBS's (company's [court] registration numbers) and OIB's (personal identification numbers) are included in HTML format. However, I changed B2 to "No" as the data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name or business ID of an entity in order to find it. Data can only be viewed individually and cannot be downloaded in bulk. More detailed company information can be viewed for free but access is restricted with a captcha. I also changed B6 to "No" as it is not mentioned how often the data are updated or when they were last updated.

answers.commentValue: The data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name or business ID of an entity in order to find it.

value.descValue: This website contains open data published by the Finnish Patent and Registration Office (PRH)

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index.

Open data are published by the Finnish Patent and Registration Office (PRH) under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 license and the Public Administration Recommendations (JHS recommendations) are applied to the material. All 4 required characteristics were found online: Finland's companies' names, addresses and unique identifiers are included in a machine-readable format, and are free of charge and freely available (http://avoindata.prh.fi/index_en.html). The data are updated once a day and can be accessed over HTTP, and Javascript Object Notation (JSON) is used for transmitting the data. However, the data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name or business ID of an entity in order to find it.

Basic company information including business ID and address can also be searched for directly on the Finnish Patent and Registration Office's website for free (https://virre.prh.fi/novus/companySearch). However, this time the data are in HTML format and are still available through a search mask so again, it is necessary to know the name or business ID of an entity in order to find it. Accessing more detailed information requires payment.

reviewComments:
To find elections results data you need to go through the general institution information (such as Mission/Vision) tab, open a sub window for “Electoral Processes” and the last option goes to “Electoral Statistical System” (https://app03.cne.gob.ec/EstadisticaCNE/Ambito/Resultados/Resultado_Electoral.aspx) , where you can find the data in XLXS and HTML format. More logical pages to find the data, such as the Statistics page, only contain PDFs with elections analysis and research papers. Submitter was also able to find another link to access the information: https://app03.cne.gob.ec/EstadisticaCNE/Ambito/Index.aspx 
Changed B2.3 from a 3 score to 2. 
It is possible to explore elections data by electoral zones through the app but it is not possible to download it on a unified file. Datasets do not include Spoiled ballots information. B3 was changed to dismiss this characteristic and it was added the data available at polling station (electoral zones). B8 remains consistent. Actually, there’s a Copyright license for 2013 Presidential elections data (http://resultados2013.cne.gob.ec/) and by the end of the general elections results web app. 
Results are also available in HTML, so it was included this format in B8.
B9. The spreadsheets are clean, but the information is highly divided in different files, which makes it difficult to analyse and compare data. Changed the score from 3 to 1.

reviewComments: Not all 4 required characteristics were found online. More specifically, although the register is available for the entire country, the General Commercial Registry page (https://www.businessregistry.gr/publicity/index) only offers a company's name and registry number and not the address. Hence the original submission, which stated that all 4 required characteristics were available online, was rejected. Also, the original submission did not provide a Source URL where the data could be found. Lastly, the original submission stated that the data are available online without the need to register or request access to the data. In reality, data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the name of an entity in order to find it. Hence, only one entity can be searched and viewed/downloaded at a time and the dataset is not downloadable at once.

New Zealand Companies Office, part of Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment

reviewComments:
Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index. 

The website is easily found through a Google search for "new zealand company register" which leads to the Companies Office page (https://www.companiesoffice.govt.nz). All 4 required characteristics were found online: New Zealand's companies' names, addresses and unique identifiers are included in company extracts which can be viewed online as .HTML files or viewed and downloaded in .PDF form. Annual Returns and Financial Statements are also available in image-based .PDF form. According to user kayakr on the discuss.okfn.org forum, the data are potentially available as JSON via the NZBN API https://api.business.govt.nz/api/apis/info?name=NZBN&version=v3&provider=mbiecreator#tab0 (provided one signs up to the MBIE API Access Agreement and can successfully authenticate). The data are publicly available and can be downloaded for free from the Companies Office website. However, the data are available through a search mask and it is necessary to know the names of an entity in order to find it. For every search only the first 200 results are automatically available and one needs to complete a form to request the remaining results of their search. Data are updated on different dates. For instance, CITIBANK, N.A. (377792) was lastly updated on 01/06/2016 while DEUTSCHE BANK AKTIENGESELLSCHAFT (834338) on 19/12/2016 (today's date is 08/02/2017).
details: Progress towards fully open and searchable data is underway.

reviewComments: Your submission is valid. Thank you very much for contributing to the Global Open Data Index. People have complained about corrupted data files and outdated data on the data.gov.uk page (https://data.gov.uk/dataset/basic-company-data) so downloading them directly from the Companies House website (http://download.companieshouse.gov.uk/en_output.html) is preferable. value.descValue: Corresponde a los datos del Presupuesto General de la Nación de Gastos del ejercicio vigente aprobado por Ley Anual de Presupuesto más las modificaciones presupuestarias aprobadas por disposición legal. De acuerdo a la Ley 1535/99, la vigencia del ejercicio financiero se inicia el 1 de enero y finaliza el 31 de diciembre de cada año. El Presupuesto General de la Nación está integrado por los presupuestos de ingresos, gastos y financiamiento de los Organismos y Entidades del Estado definidos en el Art. 3 de la Ley 1535/99. La publicación de ésta información es requerida por el Art. 10 Inc. a) de la Ley 5282/2015 de Acceso a la Información Pública.
